body.message_content:
Buy DXJ Jan 50/52 Call Spread for $0.35, ref 47.45, 13d. 4.7x net payout.

We can also discuss single stock and Topix banks index (TPNBNK) ideas.

The Republican sweep means higher USD and yields are a foregone conclusion. We see USDJPY reaching 120 next year and Japanese reflation, bullish for Japanese equities, particularly the banks.
- Huge focus on Banks/Financials post Trump election; they are the big winners.
- The banking sector is the main beneficiary of higher rates and less regulation overhang.
- Investors are still underweight Japan, especially in financials, so the move can have legs.
- Valuation is still at depressed levels. Japanese banks are cheap versus their peers.
- Uncertainty remains, so buying calls and call spreads makes sense. Instead of building a large cash position, we believe options are a better play in case the market reverses and initiates a risk-off move again.
- BAML expects USDJPY 115-120 by end of 2017 with NKY targeting 20,000 (12% upside).
- BOJ refraining from further flattening of the local yield curve is positive for banks and insurers.
- DXJ carries a 12% weight in banks whereas NKY is only 1.07% and TPX is 8.55%.
- Positioning is light: DXJ shares outstanding are at three-year lows as foreigners have sold roughly $52bln of Japanese equities year-to-date.
- DXJ skew remains flat; 2m 25d put/call skew sits at the 19th percentile over the past year.

Japan Investment Strategy, Japan Econ Outlook and Japan Macro Watch attached.
